void ATOTimePeriod::appendGrid (  ATOGrid *  grid  ) 
 

convinience function.

resizes the array and tacks on the grid

bool ATOTimePeriod::add (  ATOTimePeriod *  other  ) 
 

first compares time and unit to assure the grids match up.

next searches other time period for grids matching in this time period. if they match, they are added.

ATOTimePeriod * ATOTimePeriod::copy (   ) 
 

return a copy of this class, it's up to the user to delete it.

int ATOTimePeriod.getnumoutput (   ) 
 

i made numoutput private on purpose, because it should never have public write priveledges.

the appendGrid takes care of the numoutput variable, and if desired this function can be used to get the value of it.
